etymology.description: Depicts either an arm bending out from the side of the body, or a wooden plough
etymology.interpretation: The character 力(lì, 'strength') visually represents physical power through the image of an arm or tool, emphasizing the fundamental concept of muscular force.

examples.chinese: 他用尽全力(他用盡全力)，赢得比赛(贏得比賽)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng jìn quánlì, yíng dé bǐsài.
examples.english: He used all his strength to win the competition.

examples.chinese: 他把力气用在学习上(他把力氣用在學習上)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ lìqì yòng zài xuéxí shàng.
examples.english: He applies his strength to his studies.

examples.chinese: 面对困难(面對困難)，他毫不退缩(他毫不退縮)，全力以赴(全力以赴)。
examples.pinyin: Miànduì kùnnán, tā háo bù tuìsuō, quánlì yǐ fù.
examples.english: Facing difficulties, he neither retreats nor gives up, but goes all out.
